en: And Satan stood up against Israel, and moved David to number Israel.
hmr: Setan chu Israel mihai chunga chun a hung tho a, David chu Israel mihai chu ân tiemtir tah a.

en: And David said to Joab and to the princes of the people, Go, number Israel from Beer-sheba even to Dan; and bring me word, that I may know the sum of them.
hmr: David chun Joab le mipuihai hotuhai kuoma chun, “Fe unla, Beer- sebaa inthawka Dan chenin Israelhai chu hung tiem unla, an ni zât ka hriet theina dingin thu mi hung intlun ro,” a ta.

en: And Joab said, Jehovah make his people a hundred times as many as they are: but, my lord the king, are they not all my lord’s servants? why doth my lord require this thing? why will he be a cause of guilt unto Israel?
hmr: Joab chun, “LALPA chun a mihai chu an ni hlak zât let za khawma sukpung sienla, ka pu lal, ka pu siehlawhai an ni vawng tho a ni naw am a nih? Iengdingin am ka pu hin hieng ang thil hi a hriet nuom a ni leh? Israel ta dingin iengdingin am rîtlona bul hung ni el a ta?” a ta.

en: Nevertheless the king’s word prevailed against Joab. Wherefore Joab departed, and went throughout all Israel, and came to Jerusalem.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, lal thu chun Joab chu a hne tah a. Chuongchun, Joab chu a fe suok a, Israel ram po po chu a fang suok a, Jerusalemah a hung nâwk a.

en: And Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people unto David. And all they of Israel were a thousand thousand and a hundred thousand men that drew sword: and Judah was four hundred threescore and ten thousand men that drew sword.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun mipuihai tiem- na nizât chu David kuomah a pêk tah a. Chuongchun, Israel rama mi chu kâwlhnâm chawi thei ṭhieu mi mak- taduoi khat le nuoi khat an na; Judaa chun kâwlhnâm chawi thei ṭhieu chu mi nuoi li le sîng sari an nih.

en: But Levi and Benjamin counted he not among them; for the king’s word was abominable to Joab.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Benjamin chi le Levi mihai chu anni lai chun a tiem sa ve nawh a; Joab ngaia chun lal thu chu theida a um vieu si leiin.

en: And God was displeased with this thing; therefore he smote Israel.
hmr: Chun, hi thila hin Pathien chu a lâwm ta naw hle el a; chuleiin, Israel ram chu a hung hrem tah a.

en: And David said unto God, I have sinned greatly, in that I have done this thing: but now, put away, I beseech thee, the iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.
hmr: Chun, David chun Pathien kuom- ah, “Hi thil ka lo thaw taa hin, nasa- takin thil ka suksuol a nih; amiruok- chu, tuhin ka ngên che, i siehlaw khawhlona hi ngaidam rawh; invêt thlâktakin ka lo thaw ta sih a,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Gad, David’s seer, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun David zâwl- nei Gad kuoma chun, “Fe la, David kuoma chun hieng hin va hril rawh.

en: Go and speak unto David, saying, Thus saith Jehovah, I offer thee three things: choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: ‘Thil pathum ka ruotpêk cheh a, hi laia pakhat hi thlang rawh, i ta dinga ka thawpêk theina ding chein,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: So Gad came to David, and said unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, Take which thou wilt:
hmr: Chuongchun, Gad chu David kuoma chun a feh a, a kuoma chun, “LALPA chun hieng hin a tih; i dittak thlang rawh;

en: either three years of famine; or three months to be consumed before thy foes, while the sword of thine enemies overtaketh thee; or else three days the sword of Jehovah, even pestilence in the land, and the angel of Jehovah destroying throughout all the borders of Israel. Now therefore consider what answer I shall return to him that sent me.
hmr: kum thum sûng ṭâm amanih; i hmêlmahai kâwlhnâmin a hnawt phâk pha cheh a, ihmêlmahai hmaa thla thum sûng sukbohmanga um amanih; annawleh, Israel ram sûng po poa LALPA vântirkoin hung sukse a, ram sûnga hri hung inlêng a, LALPA kâwlhnâm chu ni thum sûng tuor chu. Tuhin ngaituo la, ieng dawnna am a mi tirtu kuoma chun kân kîr nâwk ding a na,” a ta.

en: And David said unto Gad, I am in a great strait: let me fall, I pray, into the hand of Jehovah; for very great are his mercies: and let me not fall into the hand of man.
hmr: Chun, David chun Gad kuoma chun, “Nasatakin ka lunginzîng a,LALPA kutah a tlûkin tlulût phawt el ka tih; a zângaina chu a nasa sih a, chuleiin, mihriem kuta chun mîn tlûktir êm naw nih,” a ta.

en: So Jehovah sent a pestilence upon Israel; and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun Israel chunga chun hri a tir tah a, Israel mihai chu sîng sari an thi a.

en: And God sent an angel unto Jerusalem to destroy it: and as he was about to destroy, Jehovah beheld, and he repented him of the evil, and said to the destroying angel, It is enough; now stay thy hand. And the angel of Jehovah was standing by the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
hmr: Chun, Pathien chun sukse dingin Jerusalema chun vântirko a tir a; chuonga a suksiet ding lai tak chun LALPA chun a hmuh a, thil ṭha naw thaw a tum chu ân kîr a; chuongchun, a suksetu ding vântirko kuoma chun, “A hun tah, i kut tuhin chel hri rawh,” a ta. Chun, vântirko chu Jebus mi Ornan hrizâwla chun a ngîr ta zing a.

en: And David lifted up his eyes, and saw the angel of Jehovah standing between earth and heaven, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.
hmr: Chun, David chu a hung dâk suok a, LALPA vântirko hnuoi le vân kâra ngîr chu a hang hmu tah a; a kâwlhnâm phawi sain, Jerusalem tienga bân pharin a hmuh a. Chun, David le upahai chu saiip puon an sil a, an hmaia hnuoi sikin an bawk tâwl tah a.

en: And David said unto God, Is it not I that commanded the people to be numbered? even I it is that have sinned and done very wickedly; but these sheep, what have they done? let thy hand, I pray thee, O Jehovah my God, be against me, and against my father’s house; but not against thy people, that they should be plagued.
hmr: Chun, David chun Pathien kuoma chun, “Mipuihai chu tiem dinga thu pe kha kei ka ni naw am a nih? Khawhlotaka thawa, lo suk- suol ta kha kei ngei ka nih; ami- ruokchu, hieng berâm ruolhai hin ieng am an thawh a? Aw LALPA ka Pathien, ka hni che, i kut chu ka chunga le ka thlatuhai sûngkaw chunga hin tla sienla; i mihai chung- ah ni loin, hri tuora an um nawna dingin,” a ta.

en: Then the angel of Jehovah commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up, and rear an altar unto Jehovah in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
hmr: Chun, LALPA vântirko chun, Jebus mi Ornan hrizâwla chun LALPA ta dinga mâichâm hang bâwl dingin David chu fe dingin, David kuoma hril dingin Gad chu thu a pêk tah a.

en: And David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spake in the name of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Gad hril ang chun, LALPA hminga a hril ang ngei chun David chu a hang fe tah a.

en: And Ornan turned back, and saw the angel; and his four sons that were with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
hmr: Chun, Ornan chu a hei ngha kîr chun vântirko chu a hmuh a, a naupasalhai pali ama le umhai ruok chu an inbi a. Ornan chun bu a chîl lai a na.

en: And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshing-floor, and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.
hmr: Chun, David chun Ornan a hung pan chun Ornan chun a hei en a, David chu a hmu a, hrizâwla inthawk chu a hung suok a, a hmaia hnuoi sikin David hmaa chun a kûn tah a.

en: Then David said to Ornan, Give me the place of this threshing-floor, that I may build thereon an altar unto Jehovah: for the full price shalt thou give it me, that the plague may be stayed from the people.
hmr: Chun, David chun Ornan kuom- a chun, “LALPA ta dinga mâichâm ka siem theina dingin hi hrizâwl hmun hi mi pe rawh; a man huntâwk zet angin mi pêng i ta; mipuihaia inthawka hri ân kieng theina dingin,” a ta.

en: And Ornan said unto David, Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes: lo, I give thee the oxen for burnt-offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meal-offering; I give it all.
hmr: Chun, Ornan chun David kuom- ah, “Nangmân la el rawh, ka pu lal hin a ngai a ṭha a ti ang peiin thaw el raw se; en ta, hi bâwngchal pumraw- hmang thilinhlâna dingin ka pêk cheh a, bu vuokna thuomhnawhai hi a thing dingin, chun, bu hi bu thilinhlân dingin; a rêngin ka pêk vawng che a nih,” a ta.

en: And king David said to Ornan, Nay; but I will verily buy it for the full price: for I will not take that which is thine for Jehovah, nor offer a burnt-offering without cost.
hmr: Chun, lal David chun Ornan kuoma chun, “Ni lo e a, a man kim chie ang takin kân châwk ding annâwm; nangma ta chu LALPA ta dingin ka lâkpêk ding che a ni nawh a, chun, pumrawhmang thilinhlân khawm chu man bo chun kân hlân ding a ni nawh,” a ta.

en: So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Ornan kuoma chun rângkachak a bûk a, shekel za ruk a hmun man ding chun a pêk tah a.

en: And David built there an altar unto Jehovah, and offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings, and called upon Jehovah; and he answered him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt-offering.
hmr: Chun, Davidin chutaka chun mâichâm chu LALPA ta dingin a siem a, pumrawhmang thilinhlân le, in- remna thilinhlân chu ân hlân a, LALPA chu a ko tah a; chun, ama chun vâna inthawk chun pumraw- hmangna mâichâm chungah meiin a zuk dawn tah a.

en: And Jehovah commanded the angel; and he put up his sword again into the sheath thereof.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun vântirko chu thu a pêk a; a kâwlhnâm chu a bâwma chun a khum nâwk tah a.

en: At that time, when David saw that Jehovah had answered him in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
hmr: Chu huna chun, Jebus mi Ornan hrizâwla chun LALPA chun a zuk dawn ti a hmu phing chun chutaka chun ân thâwi tah a.

en: For the tabernacle of Jehovah, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt-offering, were at that time in the high place at Gibeon.
hmr: LALPA biekbûk thlalêra Mosien a siem le, pumrawhmang thilin- hlânna mâichâm chu, chu huna chun Gibeona bâwlhmuna chun a la um zing sih a.

en: But David could not go before it to inquire of God; for he was afraid because of the sword of the angel of Jehovah.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chu hmaa chun Pathien rawn dingin David chu a fe thei nawh a,LALPA vântirko kâwlhnâm lei chun a ṭi tlat sih a.
